data.title: The Lettuce Inn - slightly different name, same owner and food
data.text: The Lettuce Inn  - formerly called Lettuce In but changed over a name dispute - is a small treasure in downtown Concord.  It only seats 20, half of those outside.  But you can easily get something to go and take it across to Todos Santos Park and eat under the trees.  Karen Bell has established a fresh food healthy eating haven downtown. There are creative combinations ranging from turkey sandwiches to full raw vegan creations.  I eat here two or three times a month, often getting a half sandwich and salad combinations. Don't be afraid to try the noodles made out of seaweed or some such vegan strangeness, Everything is delicious and you will feel much better having powered up with some good healthy food. It is a clean and simple place where you really feel welcome.

data.title: Best Clean Eats Place ever!
data.text: This is a very tiny and busy best healthy food place in Concord. If you are looking for healthy food, this is your place. They feature All Fresh Vegan choices as well as gluten free and Cleans eats. It's small and very busy at lunch time, I go either at 11:30 am or after 1 pm. Parking in front is almost impossible, there's a parking garage and the next street over behind the restaurant is 4 hr. street parking.

data.title: Innovative Fresh Food
data.text: It's a simple place for salad and sandwiches, but the recipes and ingredients are excellent.  Whether it's a vegan dish, a fairly traditional salad, or something with meat, the dishes have a certain flair.  I've had the salmon salad and a panini sandwhich -- both were very, very good.

data.title: Great Find
data.text:
Loved my raw tacos! I teach pt nearby and what a find! Great healthy fare
Ill be a regularly. My sister is a vegan and after eating here I told her I'll treat her to a birthday lunch soon. 

Feels so good to eat good,clean, food! Yum!

data.title: Great Vegan Choice
data.text: I love this little place! Located right in the heart of downtown Concord, Todos Santos park. They have wonderful and delicious choices for vegans as well as any other dietary restrictions. Everything if fresh made, right before your eyes and some of the choices are very unique, like sundried tomato and sunflower seeds for taco meat.

data.title: Lunch with a twist of Excellence
data.text: Have to say the food here is very tasty and a great selection for Vegan or something on the lighter side, Tuna, Chicken or Grill Salmon. My second time here now, first time had the Tuna sandwich and was so fresh and nice to have with a side salad. Then I spoiled myself with the grill Salmon sandwich also in a salad if you want. What a treat for freshness and made to your satisfaction. Give it a try they also have smoothies which I plan to have soon.

data.title: Excellent food and quite healthful.
data.text: Food was really fresh and good.  Nice and healthy.  Excellent choices.  Very tasty.  Friendly staff.  Good place for lunch.

data.title: Outstanding Vegetarian and Raw Food Restaurant
data.text: Located on the corner of Todos Santo square, in the center of Concord, California, is an unbelieveably excellent restaurant, Lettuce In. This restaurant specializes in vegetarian, vegan and raw food entrees and drinks.  Open for lunch and dinner, six days a week, they provide well crafted and delicious fare. Unfortunately, their dining space is small, yet comfortable. They also provide cooking classes and demonstrations. You'll be amazed at what they create, and it's very healthy!

data.title: Excellent Salads, Vegan and Vegetarian Options-- Fresh and Made to Order
data.text:
For a long time I had been complaining that there was no place to get a decent salad around Todos Santos Plaza in Concord. Well, I had to eat my words last month when I discovered that this very respectable salad shop had been open for almost two years! (Just goes to show that I never really looked past the ice cream shop next door!)
Lettuce In is tiny, but the salads are substantial and fresh. There are two or three tables inside, and another four tables outside. They have a salad special each day, and they also make wraps and smoothies. They have an assortment of homemade salad dressings and are very careful about which items are vegan, gluten free, etc.
Parking can be a challenge around the plaza, but there is a parking garage (free) within a short distance. Tuesday is Farmers' Market day year-round on Todos Santos Plaza, so you can combine your shopping with a nice lunch.
